website_summaries.verdict: A perfect toaster for anyone who enjoys artisan and thick, homemade bread thanks to it extra-long, extra-wide slots.
pros: Slots are wide and long enough to hold hand-cut bread and bagels
Offers Toast, Bagel, Reheat, Defrost, and Cancel functions, as well as 5 shade settings
Bottom cleats allow for cord storage
cons: Some owners say it doesn’t toast as evenly as they would like

customer_reviews.title: Almost great
customer_reviews.text: This toaster works well, and toasts evenly. The only negative is that it is not quite deep enough to accommodate bread made with Cuisinart's own breadmaker. Maybe the engineers for the two products should talk to each other?
customer_reviews.author: Al Balmer

customer_reviews.title: Works as well or as badly as any other toaster
customer_reviews.text: Reading reviews of various toasters I became convinced that none of them make a great piece of toast and it was really hard to choose. I got this one because I do make my own bread from time to time and liked the idea of the longer slots to fit artisinal bread. The toast is never uniform and is always darker on one side than on the other. But it hasnt ignited anything and the toast doesnt fly away, so I guess it is OK. When pushing down the lever it needs an extra push to lock in place, or it will just pop up. At first I thought it was broken till a friend pointed that out to me.
customer_reviews.author: Carole G

customer_reviews.title: Toasts Poorly, Cheap, Side Lever Issue, Cuisinart Warranty a Joke
customer_reviews.text: Worst toaster I have ever owned. The side lever does not "stick" very well or very often. It never toasts the entire bread but only about half way up. It feels cheap and the inside racks rattle around. I contact Cuisinart support for a replacement. They wanted me to pay for the shipping both ways. I've had this thing less than 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: KevinH

customer_reviews.title: BAD Quality Control. Uneven and defective. Probably hazardous to your bread at minimum.
customer_reviews.text: This toaster gets some good reviews but the one I received was not manufactured correctly. Does not heat/toast evenly. HEATING ELEMENT/COIL IS NOT MANUFACTURED CORRECTLY...see picture...multiple rows of heating elements miss-aligned/installed diagonally. Compare the two slots in the picture. THIS IS COMPLETE CRAP! Cuisinart needs to fire somebody (maybe VP of quality control/manufacturing) for building is junk. Completely unacceptable for a large appliance manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Doug C.

customer_reviews.title: Accomodating large fancy-pants slices makes me feel fancy-pants
customer_reviews.text: I have this roommate. He's French, and as such frequently enjoys those fancy-arse baguettes that just aren't cut the same way that good ol' traditional American bread loafs are - with mechanical efficiency and consistency, and not like they're cut between sessions of going on strike. Anyway, wanting to satisfy two primary requirements and one sub-requirement, I got this toaster: (1) be able to toast 4 slices of good ol' American toast at once, (1-sub1) fit it on my shallow counter top, and (c) accommodate my rommies elitist toast. It toasts well and fits the above. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: The Matterhorn

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I am saddened many of you get evenly toasted bread and I do not. Dark brown on one side barely toasted on the other, I see the other side heat up but still no toasting. I think the slots are so wide it slants to the one side that gets dark, If you put 2 pieces in one slot, the ends on both don't toast at all. Not happy
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Robison

customer_reviews.title: BAD TOASTER!!! :-(
customer_reviews.text: DON'T BUY IT!!! Only toasts one side of bread no matter what we do, and the outside of the toaster gets burning hot!!! Terrible toaster! :-( Shouldn't even be legal. If a child accidentally touhed the outside of the toaster, when it's in use, or immediately after, they would be burned.
customer_reviews.author: D. Tibbetts

customer_reviews.title: Does not toast evenly
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in this product. It is a great name brand but for the price not a good value as it DOES NOT toast evenly on both sides no matter what kind of bread or bread product irregardless of thickness. i do love the no finger print finish though. I would have returned it but I had already recycled the packaging . I will say it has nice features for toasting, if it just toasted evenly it would be a great product , but alas it does not.
customer_reviews.author: Harmony1528

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but
customer_reviews.text: It does what it is supposed. I'll take it given the dominance of the many low quality products in the market. The biggest advantage for me is that I can toast up to four slices at once and that's the reason why I purchased this. The size is right and the toaster doesn't take up much space. It has two main issues: i. the outside gets really warm. That might bother some. ii. It was designed for longer slices, so when you toast regular slices you need to use a chopstick or fork or something else to get the bread out. I thought about returning the toaster because of this, but I couldn't find a better deal than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Fugu

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistency is consistent
customer_reviews.text: Our main bread is homemade whole wheat. We purchased this unit because of the larger & longer slots. We have not, after several months of use, been able to find a happy medium temperature for toasting. The unit will blacken or burn one half of a slice on one side but not the other, or will return untoasted (or nearly so) bread. Though it may be a nice looking unit, that doesn't give us the consistent performance we expected. FYI: we do not use bagel, Pop-up tarts, or other junk food in this unit. What "store" bread we use receives the same inconsistent treatment as our homemade does. Not Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit...
customer_reviews.text: It's BLT&E season. I visit our local farmers market for fresh home grown tomatoes every August and September. A BLT&E are best when served on a good fresh artisan bread... Problem was toasting the wide bread in a standard toaster... Enter my new wide mouth toaster artisan bread toaster. This years BLT&E's are pure perfection on plate since I don't have to sacrifice the ends of the bread to fit... Some other reviews complained about uneven toasting... Sorry guys I must have gotten your toaster by mistake, as I've never experience such even toasting end to end on both sides ever before. I haven't tried all the features yet, but soon I'll be trying the bagel button.
customer_reviews.author: John Van Walsum

customer_reviews.title: Love this Toaster!
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of time reviewing various models and am VERY HAPPY with this. We eat artisan breads with lots of grains and they didn't fit in our old cheap toaster but I can actually fit all four slices in this one if I wanted to. It also handles thicker stuff like bagles well. Couldn't ask for a better product.
customer_reviews.author: A Real Person

customer_reviews.title: So far so good! Hopefully it was last just as long too!!
customer_reviews.text: This Cuisinart was meant to replace our very old KitchenAid, something we had for well over 10-years. Given the cost of this replacement, which was substantially less, we took a chance and discovered it works as well as our trusted KitchenAid. Though the stainless steel looks much better in our kitchen, it's harder to keep the sparkling look than the black finish. The children seem to find this new Cuisinart easier to use. We are quite happy that we have SO MANY choices in the world and have chosen this one, and it’s nice to make a change once in a while :-)
customer_reviews.author: Zevman

customer_reviews.title: nice looking
customer_reviews.text: you would think a toaster could actually toast bread. one side is toasted the other side is only warm but not toasted. and no it is not set to bagel setting. nice looking though. I have now been on hold 20 minutes trying to call customer service, no answer yet
customer_reviews.author: TH

customer_reviews.title: It Toasts
customer_reviews.text: How on earth are other reviewers posting negatives over a toaster!? This thing works great - the heating elements work, the food gets toasted evenly, etc. Rarely have we had to turn it past setting #3! If you were intimidated by the negative reviews, don't worry. This is a toaster that works fine!
customer_reviews.author: I'm a real customer

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster; a little tricky to get the bread out
customer_reviews.text: We love this toaster for longer artisan breads. However, the bread isn't easy to extract from the toaster if its not super tall. We have to keep a chopstick nearby to fish it out. Still, the toaster itself is excellent, reliable, and sleek looking. Just be warned about bread retrieval!
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Warning: Bad Design, Burns Fingers!
customer_reviews.text: I doubt the designers of this toaster ever used it. The design is such that the top metal is right over the heater elements and gets super hot. So you either get burned or have to wait until the toast is stone cold. Or forced to use tongs, which is really inconvenient. My previous toasters never had this problem, so I know it's not necessary. Second, the spring is strong so seems to need extra force to start toasting and the catch is poor, so sometimes needs two attempts. Another poor design thing.
customer_reviews.author: Rex Katz

customer_reviews.title: I like the appearance and size
customer_reviews.text: I like the appearance and size, but you have to press down quite hard on the lever to get it to engage and it is noisy. There is a high pitched whine of sorts while it is toasting that I find pretty annoying.
customer_reviews.author: KMKCHanson

customer_reviews.title: not bad
customer_reviews.text: Toast is a food group i my world. My previous toaster died after about 25 years of great service. I couldn't make up my mind on the higher end toasters and decided that this one would be find while I figured it out. It toasts well. It takes a long time to toast well, but does a good job. It is not stated, but it does have a crumb tray. The bagel setting works just great. It toasts long, artisan bread without a line down the middle although it is advertised as a long slotted four slice. It is light weight. I'm very satisfied with this buy.
customer_reviews.author: KParis

customer_reviews.title: Edges burn causing uneven toasting
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I have had the toaster for 18 mos and I’m finding the edges of the bread towards the middle of the slot are starting to burn causing my smoke alarm to engage. The rest of the bread is not evenly toasted so I get burned edges and semi-toasted bread. It’s a shame because I own various Cuisinart kitchen products and never had any issues or concerns except for this toaster appliance. Wouldn’t re-purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Great durable toaster
customer_reviews.text: Love this stainless steel toaster. It looks really nice in our kitchen. I also love that it can hold four slices of bread. Very convenient. Kind of expensive but worth it. Had it for over a year and it still works perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Elina

customer_reviews.title: Finally a toaster that just works
customer_reviews.text: We have tried more expensive and less expensive toasters, some that were larger, some more complicated. We have only had this one for about a week, but it's a real treat to actually put a slice of bread in and it pops up toasted on both sides evenly! English muffins, too, not burnt on the edges, just toasted on both sides evenly. First decent toaster in years. Can't speak to durability yet, the lever handle is plastic, that was a problem with a past toaster of a different brand, but hopefully this one will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: B. W. Howey

customer_reviews.title: Not useful especially for artisan or irregular size bread
customer_reviews.text: Pros: wide slots allow for 4 pieces of regular size toast at the same time. Toast evenly. Cons: There is a strong chemical scent on initial use. Please use bread you can discard for the first 2-3 times. Ironically this model is not ideal for artisan bread due to design flaw in the lever that raises the bread when done. It simply isn’t able to raise the bread out of the toaster. You will burn your fingers trying to extract bread such as baguette, smaller bagels or wide low artisan bread. See the included pictures. My fingers were submerged even with the lever at the full pushed up position.
customer_reviews.author: NA

customer_reviews.title: The toaster I received worked for 2 months, and ...
customer_reviews.text: The toaster I received worked for 2 months, and the lever to start the toaster would not stay down. Amazon would not take it back. Cuisinart did, but my replacement did not work out of the box. (That took almost 3 weeks to get.) Not confident this toaster will work. Looking for a different one.
customer_reviews.author: V. Gregg

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint I have is that it is a little difficult to get the toaster to stay in the down position. I feel like I have to put more than necessary force to keep it in the toasted position. I don't think it is a defect, I think it is just hard to stick. Other than that, I think it is a fantastic toaster. It looks nice. It cooks evenly. It has nice easy-to-read buttons. Would definitely buy again. Bought it to replace an old Oster that lasted me 12 year. Bought the new Oster that was basically the upgraded model and it had a weird whining noise, so I bought this one instead.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Abbott

customer_reviews.title: The outside is hot enough to burn your skin.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these toasters, one for the main house and one for the guest house. I do not like thick bread or bagels, so the wide toasting slots weren't something I wanted when i was looking for a toaster. But my concern is the safety pf this toaster. It was so hot on the outside that I have burned my hands at least 5 times. I thought it was just a defect in one of them and I threw it out. But the other one did the same thing to me today!!!! I'm going to throw this one out too. I'm tired of nursing burns. Toasters shouldn't get so hot on the outside.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Welch

customer_reviews.title: Returned item - wrong dimension
customer_reviews.text: Regarding this Cuisinart appliance, I cannot rate any aspect of performance.... for the following reason. I returned it because it did not fit into the available narrow countertop space in our kitchen. BEFOREi purchased this toaster, I asked (AMAZON question) about its dimensions, WITHOUT disclosing that the appliance width had to be 6" or less. The individual responding to my question said the toaster was 6" wide. Actually it is almost 7" wide. So as I stated above, I returned the toaster and cannot cannot rate any performance aspect.
customer_reviews.author: Plu Perfect

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product if looking for a long 2 slice toaster!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this toaster. It doesn’t take up a ton of space, and will toast slices of bakery long thick bread or work as a 4 slicer for English muffins/bagels when we’re making breakfast sandwiches. The temperature can be a little persnickety, I’ve seen it not toast all the way or burn within a notch of the dial, as we’re getting to know each other I’m beginning to learn the sweet spot. I wish the crumb tray was a bit wider to easily clean it more thoroughly, but it’s still a great product for the size, shape, and price.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Malloy

customer_reviews.title: Slow and uneven
customer_reviews.text: Takes a very long time to toast a piece of bread. When it does toast, the bread is toasted unevenly. The cord comes out from the front, which is kind of weird. Most electric devices have the cord coming out of the back. I don’t understand why they have a removable try, because most of the crumbs are caught in the toaster. Too bad long toasters are hard to find.
customer_reviews.author: 人

customer_reviews.title: Excellent toaster
customer_reviews.text: Very long. Can toast 4 small slices or bagels at once. Also works for wide specialty breads. Deep enough that all the bagel or bread slice is toasted instead of tops left raw. Particularly like the feature where you can push defrost and it adds that to your toasting cycle. Used to have to use two steps of defrosting item then toasting item. This does it automatically. I put a frozen bagel in this, press the bagel and defrost buttons. It first defrosts then toasts one side of the bagel. Comes out evenly toasted on one side of bagel.
customer_reviews.author: Carole Banks

customer_reviews.title: It's a toaster
customer_reviews.text: 1. It looks nice, and it does what is expected from it. The caveat is: 1. The controls are more confusing than necessary (where are all the simple reliable toasters?). 2. Much worse: the outer shell as beautiful as it is, gets rather hot. I had a similar toaster before (for long slices), which managed to get my bread nice and toasty without getting hot to the touch. UPDATE: after 2 weeks it stopped toasting. The lever that is used to push down and start the process doesn't stay down.
customer_reviews.author: LAZ

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT TOAST
customer_reviews.text: I like my toast very golden on both sides (concept!). I get that at '4' on the hit dial. Hubby prefers more of a lukewarm finish, on '2'. We use for artisan bread and have tried with 4 slices of regular bread and it works great! Bagels are perfect on bagel setting. This toaster is exactly what we wanted after replacing our old Kitchen Aid after almost 10 years. If this toaster lasts as long, we'll be thrilled. So far so good. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fisk

customer_reviews.title: Pefect!
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Toasts evenly, see photos to view both sides of 2 pieces of rye bread. This toaster needs to be set to 2 or 3 for use with regular bread (I prefer 2 to 2 1/2). Loving the Hi-Lift Lever which makes it very easy to remove the toast when finished. Have yet to test bagels, but I would assume they will toast perfectly at a higher setting. English muffins toast perfect. There were other reviews that mentioned that it does not toast evenly, but that must be a rare manufacturing flaw and I'm sure you would be able to return it for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart not what they used to be.
customer_reviews.text: When we searched for another Cuisinart to replace another toaster we owned 4-5 years ago and found the Reviews given this toaster, we were Hopeful, as Cuisinart was considered the Top of the Line years ago. What we found, on the lower toaster settings (25%) the toast was only 30% toasted on one side, and the other side 60%. In other words, it didn't toast evenly. In the higher range (50-60%) settings, the toaster did fine. However, some people don't like a medium to dark toasted bread, so this comes with a disappointment. Will be interesting to see if this toaster endures, as its predecessor (also Cuisinart) lasted over a decade with excellent toast settings at any level.
customer_reviews.author: Kent L.

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: The bread is not evenly toasted, one side is often darker then the other even though I always toast everything on the lightest setting. I usually toast more then once, but always start on the lightest setting. When I use the pop-up lever, it doesn't lift the toasted item up high enough for me to pick up the toast without burning my fingers so I have to use toaster tongs. The toaster is OK, but not as good as I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Failed after One Year
customer_reviews.text: I am updating my original review of this toaster. Mainly because it has failed. Whenever you toast anything, the 'Bagel' light goes on and it will only toast one side. Pressing the light fails to turn that function off and canceling the toast cycle does not clear the Bagel setting either. Only persistent pressing the toast arm down, canceling, pushing the toast arm down, canceling, etc will allow normal toasting, sometimes requiring you to do this a dozen times. Unfortunately, with appliances of this type, this product now is destined for the landfill. After only one year of very average toasting. I cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Quite pleased.
customer_reviews.text: The best I’ve had. Long enough for very wide bread, wide enough for bagels. The heat range is unusually wide, allowing easy toasting of sourdough (which takes more heat and time than most). Enough space for 4 slices of some smaller loafs, too. Quite pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Rudersdorf

customer_reviews.title: Love this toaster!
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Long pieces of "artisan" bread get toasted nice and brown on both sides without having to cut the slice or flip it over in the toaster. Toasts faster than my previous toaster, takes between 2 and 2 1/2 minutes. If using regular sized slices, 4 slices will fit in the toaster. The warming function works well, as does the function to toast just a bit longer if it isn't quite brown enough. (Doneness/color can vary if the slice thickness varies). So far my toast has been perfect!
customer_reviews.author: wwolfstarr

customer_reviews.title: Homemade bread, bagels and much much more...
customer_reviews.text: Where has this toaster been all my life! We are very busy family but we also like to make our own bread it's been very difficult to find a toaster that would allow homemade bread in different shapes and sizes this toaster has been a godsend and we have loved it as a family we do everything from homemade bread to Bagels and not just one Bagel my husband and I can make our Bagels at the exact same time, saving time.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L Eder

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect!
customer_reviews.text: We really like this toaster, but the slots are a little too short for us to fully toast 4 slices of bread. Two must be inserted sideways, so one end doesn't get toasted. And the slots could be just a little deeper to fully toast much of the bread we like to use. We bought this because it looked like one that would work with some of the specialty breads. But the designers must have tested something very small when they made the decisions on slot length and depth. Slot width is just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Pat T.

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk!
customer_reviews.text: This toaster turns perfectly good bread into a cracker. In addition, you get about 2mm of pullout space to remove crumbs. If you should have a toast crumb larger then a pea, you will have to unscrew a dozen screws from the bottom of the toaster to remove the crumb so smoke coming from the toaster doesn't set of a fire detector. After doing that, the toast will never work the same as the slide to send the bread down into the toaster will not stay down. At least, that was my experience - on to the next toaster...
customer_reviews.author: Thyme Lee

customer_reviews.title: Much too large for the average kitchen counter.
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak to how well this toasts bread, but want people to know it is enormous! It took up so much space on my counter that I immediately boxed it for return without using it. I bought it because we eat mostly artisan breads and they don't fit into regular toasters. Plus my Cuisinart food processor from the 80s is still holding up well, so I trust the brand. I gave it 4 stars because it's not fair to downgrade it just because I misunderstood the size, but I do want other buyers to be aware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: When it works it's pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Be aware that this toaster has a habit of popping up at random times - very irritating. We called Cuisinart to get a replacement (after three months), they promised to send one out, but three weeks later we have been told that it is boxed ready to go out, but they can't find it. when I said to send another, I got nowhere. There Customer Service is awful - you have to wait for up to 45 minutes to get through, and then it's like pulling teeth. Will never buy another Cuisinart product again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Solomons

customer_reviews.title: Crazy Perfect Toast - Finally!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this toaster for several months and it passed all the tests we put it through - like lasting more than three months!! It toasts the bread a color that is consistent with the number chosen. We love the cancel button to get the toast to flip up if you change your mind. Looks great!
customer_reviews.author: claudia k.

customer_reviews.title: like this toaster
customer_reviews.text: My old toaster, a kitchen aid about 18 years old, stopped toasting except a small strip at the top of the bread. I read through all the reviews on Amazon and decided on this one. It is very light weight and I like that as I get older and am losing strength in my hands. I have only had this for about 5 days and have used it daily. I like the way is toasts bread. I have not used it for any thing else yet. There are a lot of nice options. I was surprised that most toasters really do not rate very high.
customer_reviews.author: ChefGirl

customer_reviews.title: Quit working in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: Right away it had problems with the level holding in place but we learned to deal with it...just took a few times pushing it to get it to hold. Today, it won’t toast at all anymore...just heats the bread but doesn’t toast no matter how long it’s in there
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Why only Chrome?
customer_reviews.text: Just got this toaster and so far so good but who makes a product that needs to be cleaned (fingerprints) every time you use it? would have preferred black as it hides fingerprints and doesn't have to be cleaned after every use. The Chrome looks good sitting on the counter, actually reflects like a mirror, but I'd prefer not to have to wipe prints off it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only toasts one side of bread
customer_reviews.text: Unacceptable performance. Toasts only side of the bread in either slot. The side that it does toast is close to burned at any setting above 2. My minimal expectation of a toaster is for it to toast 2 sides, I've had $10 toasters that meet this criteria. BTW, the design is great, slots are exactly what I was looking for, if only it actually toasted bread like a toaster should.
customer_reviews.author: BigSky

customer_reviews.title: Finally a toaster that works perfectly for sourdough toast!
customer_reviews.text: Sourdough bread actually fits in these slots. You don’t need to cut the bread to toast it. Temperatures are easy to set. Works well. We’re very pleased with it. It looks sharp too.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda manley

customer_reviews.title: Very good.
customer_reviews.text: I like this a heck of a lot better than the cheap $10 toaster I had and I wanted something that not only toasted 4 things at once but one that had wide slots too. This fits the bill and it toasts things evenly enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: MyFiona

customer_reviews.title: Straight forward controls, and works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toaster for my 95 year old mother, who has poor vision. The biggest reason I chose it was for the large, simple controls, and the ability to toast wide slices of bread. She reports that even though it is supposed to raise the toast high enough to remove things like English muffins without burning her fingers, it isn’t high enough to help. But don’t take my word for that, because she might not be doing it right. Other than that, she likes the toaster a lot, and I think I am going to order another just like it for my husband and myself.
customer_reviews.author: Kim G.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for bigger family & artisan breads
customer_reviews.text: Um I LOVE this toaster. I have 4 kids and can toast 6 toaster strudels at once, love the larger slots for thicker breads! It’s toasts evenly for me, it’s a damn toaster so I’m not expecting perfection but this toaster is the best I’ve ever had. It is pretty big though so if you don’t have much counter space I’d say go with a smaller one. For a bigger family though, I’m loving it!!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Paid good money for this one and it is not a ...
customer_reviews.text: It was for my wife she probably would give it three stars. Have not used any of the features on it just toast. It does not toast very even and even burnt my toast on some of the edges a little. Probably should have got another cheap toaster. Paid good money for this one and it is not a good toaster.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Overall all good toaster, but
customer_reviews.text: Have to push lever on toaster several times for it to engage in the on position. Sometimes I can get it on the first try. Top of bagels don't get toasted. Unit is just a little too short, but most folks will not even notice. I like sourdough bread and it's taller than a bagel; to the top of my sourdough bread may not get toasted, but it will fit well except for the top.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: This toaster gets very hot. So you have to be careful when removing the toast. It toasts unevenly, but works better when the setting is moderately high. At low settings only one side is toasted. To remove short slices you must use wooden tongs even when you use the lift lever. It doesn't lift the toast high enough. But it is worth the sale price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis

customer_reviews.title: Be careful or you will get burned
customer_reviews.text: The outside gets so hot that when you go to grab the toast, you will burn your hands. I bought a pair of tongs to get the toast out without getting burned.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Leggett

customer_reviews.title: Another with heating element problems.
customer_reviews.text: Even with mixed reviews - I was hoping to get one that all the positive reviews are written for without the heating element problems. The left side of the toast is burned while the right side has not yet begun to brown. As to others having problems with front and back, both front and back were evenly burned or untoasted left and right. As an aside, unable to fit four pieces of bread - maybe the brand of bread is oversized. I will continue to use the toaster I was trying to replace - a cheap 35 year old narrow slot 4 slice Toastmaster.
customer_reviews.author: Flagstaff_OldGuy

customer_reviews.title: Toasts uneven.
customer_reviews.text: Got 2 of these and sent both back. I thought the first one was just a lemon. The second one was bad as well so it went back.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Fennell

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time
customer_reviews.text: This toaster is so uneven and erratic I am never sure how the toast will come out. I leave it on the same settings and put bread in the same spot(s) and sometimes it will be just right, others it will be burnt black, and other times still it will just be warmed up. Don't bother with this one.
customer_reviews.author: jbecker2048

customer_reviews.title: I liked my old Cuisinart toaster a lot better.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried it with bagels or oversized toast, but it doesn't toast regular thickness breads evenly. I don't find the side controls to be convenient and the toaster sounds like the 15 dollar one I bought for a tenant to use. Though the chrome finish is attractive, the lever-action and the sound give the impression that it is cheaply made. I don't make a lot of toast so time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Suki Di

customer_reviews.title: Lousy toaster.
customer_reviews.text: I make sourdough bread and my old Dualit is on it's last legs. This apology for a toaster burns the bottom rear part of the slice while the rest is barely tan. And it is so slow that the toast is hard all the way through like a rusk. I'm returning it & will get new elements for the Dualit.
customer_reviews.author: plevee

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this toaster.
customer_reviews.text: Finally found a toaster to toast larger than standard size slices of bread or multiple slices of regular sizes and do it consistently and evenly. It is difficult to find a toaster that will do it as well as this one does with all the different variations of moisture and texture of bread today but this one does it for us.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: This is the absolute coolest toaster I've ever seen!
customer_reviews.text: 1. The only option for non standard sized items that you want to toast is a toaster oven, until now. Toaster ovens are cool but you have to heat a lot of space unnecessarily, in addition, the toasted piece just ain't the same. This machine solves that issue perfectly. 2. A cancel button is a fairly new item, for me anyway, an absolute must, this thing has it right on top of the buttons and it is lit when in operation. Very convenient. 3. The slidebar for setting the level of toastedness (word?) is really sensitive so you can dial in your desire very accurately. 4. I don't work for these guys, I just love my toasted breads etc.! LOL
customer_reviews.author: Patrick P.

customer_reviews.title: A Winner!
customer_reviews.text: Most rolls fit into this wide slotted toaster, as well as, rustic and oversized breads. Toasting is even. The only dislike is the cord comes out of the end near where the controls are so I had to move the countertop appliances a bit. Now that I have gotten used to it, it is not a problem but I almost returned it due to the cord location.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this to fit larger slices of bread than my previous toaster, but it’s really better in every way. It fits anything, and toasts evenly. Make sure to follow the instructions and use the bagel button for bagels - it will toast the insides more than the outsides, which is just how I want them.
customer_reviews.author: Aphrael

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It's a really great toaster. Big though. Never had a 4 slice before. It has a setting for doing Bagels. I also use that setting for doing just one side on an English Muffin. My only complaint is that the power cord comes out of the same end as the controls. Slightly limits positioning.
customer_reviews.author: Diperpiper

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Works Properly
customer_reviews.text: Toasts one side of the bread. Burns the edges. When you push the toast down, it doesn't catch and the toaster is light weight so it moves when you try to jam the toast down. You can't hold the sides to lower it, because it's hot to the touch.
customer_reviews.author: A Baker

customer_reviews.title: Better upgraded design with all the same features and half the price!*
customer_reviews.text: Modern version of an order model. We owned that one for many years until the heat wire burnt out. Old model still available White only. This chrome version different control layout with same features. Our new one toasts more evenly yet slightly darker at slot ends. Quite pleased with updated version!
customer_reviews.author: B. Speer

customer_reviews.title: Toasts artisan breads!
customer_reviews.text: You make or buy wide lovely bread then have to cut it in half to toast it. Boo.Sad face. No more! This toaster is your pal! Big, wide toasted sammiches are in your future! I’m not sure why they put the cord on the front of the toaster, but it’s a minor inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Lizabeth Martin

customer_reviews.title: Toasting Begals
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the Artisan toaster because we like the artisan sour dough bread we get at Trader Joes. We also like bagels. The bread toasts fine, but the bagels burn on both sides even on the lowest setting so we contacted Cuisinart for a replacement. They didn't have any in their warehouse so they referred us to Amazon. Amazon shipped a replacement. It burns the bagel also. Fortunately we had purchase a standard size Cuisinart from Costco which will toast the bagels and it has worked fine so we now have two Cuisinart toasters to do the two types of bread items.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Saxton

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster
customer_reviews.text: Finally a toaster that is wide enough and long enough for homemade breads. This toaster handles the job with ease. I had ordered another brand of toaster that boasted wide openings and was disappointed with it and returned it. This toaster was a bit more money but in the end, very worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Dalene Hokanson

customer_reviews.title: Working well so far
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a 4 slice that died on us and so far we are happy with it. It toasts more evenly than what we had before and I like the features. I wish that you could pop up the toast a bit further to make it easier to reach. Like our other toaster, I wish more crumbs could make it to the crumb tray. There is still quite a bit of stationary ledges for the crumbs to sit on.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Large shiny toaster
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this artisan bread toaster but the finish was glaringly shiny and the toaster is quite large. It’s difficult to come laid it on the countertop and although the unit worked OK the finish showed every fingerprint.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie S

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: This toasted no better than average when brand new. In less that 6 months it barely toasts at all and only when cycling the timer TWICE. The racks are set so that smaller pieces DO NO come out easily and the raise feature is to low. Anything else must be better.
customer_reviews.author: Asarks

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase, handles all our family needs.
customer_reviews.text: It is for daily personal use. This toaster replaces a 70 year old family toaster that was loved, repaired, and finally worn beyond repair. We shopped around for quite awhile before purchasing a new model. We are well pleased with the Cuisinart CPT-2400. My husband loves the feature of the clamping of the slice of bread to hold it in the center of the slot for more even toasting. This model was a little more expensive compared to some of the others we researched, but we wanted the four slice option and the larger (bagel like) option. Would recommend for any family use. This model will fulfill your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Lin Gunnet

customer_reviews.title: Good not GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I bake Artisan Breads. Like toast made from it in thge morning. Thought the review of this toaster would do a great job, alas not much different from Breville, Waring or 2 other brands I tried that were supposed to toast Artisan breads. I find I have to turn the toast around to get the same toast on both sides on all of them.
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: Best toaster ever
customer_reviews.text: This toaster turns any bread into excellent toast. One noticeable issue is the toaster has to be used several times to obtain maximum results.
customer_reviews.author: Rick A. Gardner

customer_reviews.title: 100% Quality
customer_reviews.text: Definitely one of the BEST Toasters I have ever owned! I had the all including the $230.00 Dualite 4 slice toaster, This Cuisinart kills them all! The more money you spend the bigger the problems. If you go too cheap even bigger troubles. This Cuisinart is the SWEET Spot!
customer_reviews.author: Paul E

customer_reviews.title: Love the extra long slot for artisan breads and also ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the extra long slot for artisan breads and also takes up much less space for 4 slices of regular bread. than most 4 slot toasters.
customer_reviews.author: godmotherx4

customer_reviews.title: Quit working in 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited about this toaster until it blew up and quit working after 3 months the leaver would not stay down, terrible customer service cant contact anyone to redeem the product's insurance. Never purchasing another Cuisinart product again.
customer_reviews.author: Z.Pan

customer_reviews.title: Toasts evenly
customer_reviews.text: I got this for the long slot (sourdough bread) and for the wide slots (hot dog and hamburger buns). It toasts more evenly than other toasters I have had. I also like the lever lift you can do that makes the toasted bread more accessible. I'll update this if I have any reliability issues.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Works good for artisan and homebaked bread.
customer_reviews.text: I like the long, wide bread slots, the bagel function and the defrost function. It doesn't toast perfectly though, one side of the bread ends up toasted more than the other side. And, it seems to take a long time to toast, drying the bread out more.
customer_reviews.author: catsndogs

customer_reviews.title: Good toaster
customer_reviews.text: The first few times we used the toaster we had a bit of adjusting to do on the darkness. Once we got it settled into the way we prefer our toast it's been good. I notice it seems to darken the edges a bit faster than the rest of the slice but not bad.
customer_reviews.author: B Porter

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this toaster three stars because it does not toast bread evenly. It took me a lot of tinkering to figure out the right setting and it still sometimes burns the edges. I've noticed that making sure the bread is directly in the center of the toaster slot makes the bread come out even. However, I bought this toaster to fit larger pieces of bread and if the bread gets too close to the edges of the slot, they burn. Kind defeats the point. I will say, though, that it is beautifully designed and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this toaster. ( This is a real review)
customer_reviews.text: For the longest time, I've been wanting a 4 slice/ bagel toaster. When I purchased this toaster, I was still using my 20 year- old toaster for 2 slices which works fine for regular size bread. Finally, I break out this new toaster and used it for a bagel. Well, it burned it on a 3. I used it again and lower it to 2, still pretty dark. The issue is the temperature settings. It does not matter which setting because it is overheating and burning everything!. Do not buy this toaster, something is definitely wrong with the heating element.
customer_reviews.author: crystal

customer_reviews.title: Yep it’s a toaster & it works great
customer_reviews.text: I read mixed reviews on this toaster prior to purchase but also read glowing consumer product reviews elsewhere online. So I gave it a try. This toaster is great. There is nothing wrong with it. It toasts bread - of any size!! It’s not complicated. It’s pretty. It worked right out of the box. The only downside: fingerprints.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Toaster
customer_reviews.text: Over all its a great unit and the settings are accurate. The only downside I noticed is that the outside elements are not as strong ans the inner and therefor the sides of the toast are not even. This might be intentional as it says to put the outside of bagels toward the outer elements. Over all I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: DMAdam47

customer_reviews.title: Very big machine
customer_reviews.text: A big shiny toaster, bigger than I anticipated, but works well and especially for long slices of artisanal bread or four normal slices. I gave it 4 rather than 5 stars because I was expecting a more compact appliance, because I have not yet tried all the functions, and I have only had the toasted for a few weeks and only used it a few times. Time will tell. Looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Kirshenblatt-Gimblett

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Like almost every Cuisinart product... this just works like it’s supposed to. Nothing too fancy, it does what it is supposed to... make great toast. Sent back the Breville I had bought first. It had great features, was beautiful but made crappy toast. Can’t go wrong with this one AND it’s half the price of the Breville
customer_reviews.author: Hamburger King of 9Th Street

customer_reviews.title: really pretty
customer_reviews.text: I really love the look of this toaster, as well as the oversized slots. It is a great toaster, but the temp controls do seem to be a little low. So to get good golden toast we are well set over 5- not a bad thing, just FYI. Bagels are awesome in it, as well as homemade breads
customer_reviews.author: GG Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Wide slots, even toasting
customer_reviews.text: The slots are not quite long enough to fit two standard sandwich loaf slices in each slot without overlapping, but it still toasts them well. The slots are wide enough for waffles. It toasts very evenly across both slots.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Dorman

customer_reviews.title: Good toaster
customer_reviews.text: Great toaster, biggest issue is that it does not toast well around the front and backlist edges of the toaster slots. Luckily for me I do not toast a lot of artisan bread so I have the room to move the slices inward to correct the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Sparticus414

customer_reviews.title: It burned after only 3 month of use!
customer_reviews.text: It burned after only 3 month of use. We noticed all over sudden a grey-ish looking layer and chemical smell on our toast! Followed by dark smoke coming out of the toaster then we saw that part of it's material ( photo ) literally melted and deformed itself in front of our eyes. Before the photo was taken, the bubble was even much bigger. That was kind of a shock and we obviously threw all the toast obviously away. I really hope to get our money back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a world-class toaster!!
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the best toaster I have ever owned. It works perfectly for bagels and thicker sliced bread. And, it is gorgeous to look at! It gleams like a modern day version of a 1950s toaster. It looks awesome in my kitchen. I highly recommend this superb toaster. The quality, performance and looks are best in class!
customer_reviews.author: Caprityme

customer_reviews.title: Works like a second hand toaster.
customer_reviews.text: The toasters heating coils do not heat up all the way. Some are orange, some have a hit of orange, and some stay gray. I have to toast my bread, waffles, even my kids toaster strudels. It's upsetting, I paid a lot of money to get an excellent toaster and it's like I have a second hand toaster. When I can, I'm going to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Van Ness

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster
customer_reviews.text: Finally a toaster that toast bread evenly and can accommodate just about any size or type of bread.
customer_reviews.author: Bergeek

customer_reviews.title: Nice toaster
customer_reviews.text: The toaster is very nice for the price. I wanted a higher end toaster, but honestly I just couldn’t pull the trigger on a toaster that costs that cost $100 plus! Maybe next time I’ll do it...
customer_reviews.author: Silktaboo

customer_reviews.title: Artisan Toaster
customer_reviews.text: This product is receiving a Single Star because you could not toast a single slice of bread from a normal size loaf. Worked perfectly if your slice was the entire length of the toaster, otherwise you were out of luck
customer_reviews.author: KO

customer_reviews.title: More Options for Bread/Toast Size
customer_reviews.text: Good looking, controls are simple and the slot width and length allows thawing, toasting and re-heating lots of different breads. ie: Standard Bread, Bagel, Dark Rye, Hot Dog/ Hamburger Buns, etc.
customer_reviews.author: George C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for large slices
customer_reviews.text: It is nice to be able to toast a slice of sourdough bread without having to cut it in half first. The temperature set took a while to settle in, but is doing just fine now. Looks very sleek and clean on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Jackson

product_meta.title: Cuisinart Bakery Artisan Bread Toaster, 2 Slice, Silver
product_meta.description: Toasting rustic artisan and thick homemade breads requires a special toaster, and Cuisinart comes through once more! The Bakery Artisan Bread Toaster has two extra-long, extra-wide 10" x 11/2" slots to hold the healthy, fresh kinds of bread people are buying. Toasts big, chunky, hand-cut slices - and regular thick to thin breads or bagels - all to the shade selected. Controls are large and intuitive; everything about this toaster is easy! Beautifully designed and durably constructed, it delivers the superior performance you expect from the best!. Features: 1500 watts of power|Extra large dual slots (10” x 1.5”) perfect for artisan breads|Chrome housing|Hi Lift lever|Toast functions: - Toast - Bagel - Reheat - Defrost - Cancel|Pull out crumb tray|Cord storage|6 Shade Settings|Self centering bread slots
feature_bullets: Extra-large dual slots (10" x 1. 5"): Perfect for artisan breads
Toaster functions: Toast, Bagel, Reheat, Defrost, Cancel. 6 shade settings
Pull-out crumb tray; 1500 watts of power

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars1,151 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
